meanings.definition: Of or relating to a praetor.
meanings.sent1: The praetorial robes worn by the official were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The praetorial authority was evident in his commanding presence.
meanings.sent3: The praetorial speech he gave made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her praetorial gaze seemed to see right through me.
meanings.sent5: The praetorial responsibilities weighed heavily on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: The building's design had a praetorial grandeur.
meanings.sent2: Her praetorial demeanor exuded confidence and authority.
meanings.sent3: The cat's praetorial stance made it look like a tiny ruler.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood praetorial against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The old castle had a praetorial air of mystery.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the office or duties of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: The praetorial responsibilities included overseeing legal matters.
meanings.sent2: His praetorial role required him to uphold justice.
meanings.sent4: She approached her praetorial tasks with diligence and care.
meanings.sent5: The praetorial decisions made by the council affected the entire city.
